title: Moist Strawberry Shortcake Cake with Whipped Cream Frosting
promptIMG: Moist Strawberry Shortcake Cake, on plate, natural food photography, balanced sharp focus, zero blur throughout entire image, infinite depth of field, realistic food textures, modern kitchen background in sharp focus, natural lighting, kitchen countertop visible, even focus distribution, documentary food photography, natural sharpness --no blur, depth of field, bokeh, over-sharpening, artificial enhancement --quality 2 --raw --stylize 300
description: Indulge in this delightful moist strawberry shortcake cake, layered with fluffy vanilla cake, juicy macerated strawberries, and topped with airy whipped cream frosting. Perfect for warm-weather celebrations, itâ€™s a refreshing dessert that will impress your guests and satisfy your sweet tooth.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cake pans and smooth the tops.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 10 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
While the cakes are cooling, macerate the strawberries by mixing them with a tablespoon of sugar and letting them sit for 15 minutes.
In a separate bowl, whip the heavy cream and powdered sugar until stiff peaks form.
Once the cakes are cool, place one layer on a serving plate, spread a layer of whipped cream, and top with macerated strawberries.
Place the second cake layer on top and frost the top and sides with the remaining whipped cream.
Garnish with additional strawberries and serve.
tips: For the best results, use fresh, ripe strawberries and ensure your whipped cream is whipped to stiff peaks for a perfect frosting consistency.

structured_content.content: This moist strawberry shortcake cake is a delightful blend of fluffy vanilla cake and juicy strawberries, topped with a light whipped cream frosting. It's perfect for any warm-weather celebration, bringing a touch of elegance to your dessert table.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 50 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for summer gatherings and celebrations
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Visually stunning with its layered presentation

structured_content.content: I remember making this cake for my familyâ€™s summer barbecue, and it was a hit! The combination of fresh strawberries and whipped cream always brings back fond memories of warm sunny days.

• Main ingredient: Fresh strawberries are key for sweetness and flavor; choose ripe ones for the best results.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the cake's flavor; opt for pure extract for the best taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: Heavy cream is essential for the frosting, providing a rich and airy texture.
  • Equipment needed: Two 9-inch round cake pans, mixing bowls, and a hand mixer or stand mixer for whipping cream.

upload.context: Preparation of the ingredients for the strawberry shortcake cake, showcasing the fresh strawberries and cake batter.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by preheating your oven and preparing your cake pans. Cream the butter and sugar until fluffy, then add the wet ingredients.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Mix the dry ingredients separately, then combine with the wet mixture. Bake until golden and a toothpick comes out clean.
Finishing Touches:
Layer the cakes with whipped cream and strawberries, and frost the top and sides for a beautiful presentation.

upload.context: Cooking process of the strawberry shortcake cake, highlighting the baking and layering steps.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Ensure your butter is at room temperature for easy creaming.
  • A common mistake is overmixing the batter; mix just until combined.
  • Check for doneness by inserting a toothpick into the center of the cake.
  • Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: This cake is a family favorite, often made for birthdays and special occasions. Sharing it with loved ones makes it even more special.
Consider adding a splash of lemon juice to the strawberries for a zesty twist or infusing the whipped cream with a hint of almond extract for extra depth.
This cake pairs beautifully with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a glass of chilled lemonade, making it perfect for summer gatherings.
For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. You can also swap strawberries for other berries like blueberries or raspberries.

upload.context: Final plated dish of the moist strawberry shortcake cake, beautifully garnished and ready to serve.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Chill your mixing bowl before whipping cream for better volume.
  • Use a serrated knife to slice the cake layers evenly.
  • Assemble the cake just before serving to keep the layers fresh.
  • Decorate with mint leaves for an elegant touch.

structured_content.content: Don't hesitate to try this recipe! The joy of creating and sharing this beautiful cake will surely bring smiles to your table.
